Can you rewrite this so it sounds like a winning proposal for an EU grant, include research references if needed and keep it short: 


Many economists believe that getting back on track, and achieving financial stability, developing countries such as Lebanon need to focus their investments on their internal resources such as the Food & Beverage sector and the tourism sector. Many of the Lebanese population have already taken that step and started their own small scale Agro-food and Mounet production, and many are now eligible to take their business a step further and produce on a bigger scale and cater to a larger market. 

This project aims to ameliorate small local Lebanese food-production businesses and get them up and running on their own, which will eventually impact their standards of living as a community and the standards of the Lebanese population as a whole. Local entrepreneurs that meet the project’s selection criteria will be provided with the right guidance and trainings by professional food-safety experts and business experts to equip them with better knowledge on how to produce quality-improved products and how to use their competitive edge to integrate themselves and compete in bigger markets, all while ensuring an efficient delivery system and maintaining food safety standards and making them eligible for Label attainment. As a way to assess the new food production performance, entrepreneurs are to submit their old and new product for Pre and Post assessment which if succeeded, will become eligible to obtain a certification label on their products which will grant them an advantage to compete on a larger scale and possibly export their products.  Acquiring the Label, small food-production businesses will enhance brand recognition and guarantee product quality to customers. They also prove to internal and later on external authorities that the production site is safe and legal. In addition, small producers will benefit from being positioned as Certified Food Production Facility which will:

Enhance their brand’s credibility.
Secure Customer confidence.
Protect the whole supply chain.
Acquire a competitive edge. 
Drive growth and gain market access across the world. 
Improve supplier standards and consistency in raw material
Provide concise information to assist with due diligence 


Producer selection will be based on the results obtained through a series of questionnaires, surveys, and field visits to better assess their eligibility to this project. Collected data will be analyzed and projected as information on what type of assistance they should get and how. Based on those results, we will develop a detailed curriculum covering the following topics:

Good Manufacturing & Hygienic Practices Training
Marketing, digital marketing and branding/ Communication and Leadership
Introduction to Accounting and Cost Analysis: Training on efficient methods of accounting, proper cost analysis and bookkeeping
Personal development and soft skills

An excellent way to reach a goal is to learn and execute on the spot. During their training, Entrepreneurs are requested to draft their business plan covering their future strategy and predicts a 5-year growth proposal.

Title: Enhancing Local Lebanese Food Production: A Scalable and Sustainable Approach

Executive Summary:

Economic recovery and financial stability in developing countries such as Lebanon hinge upon strategic investments in internal resources, particularly the Food & Beverage and tourism sectors (Stiglitz, 2002; Sachs, 2015). The proposed project seeks to empower local Lebanese entrepreneurs in small-scale agro-food and Mounet production by upgrading their capabilities, enabling them to compete in larger markets while maintaining high-quality and food safety standards. Through targeted guidance, training, and certification, we aim to improve the livelihoods of these entrepreneurs and, by extension, the entire Lebanese community.

Project Objectives:

1. Strengthen small local Lebanese food-production businesses through capacity-building initiatives and professional guidance from food-safety and business experts.
2. Enhance food quality and safety standards, enabling producers to obtain Label certification for increased brand credibility and market access.
3. Equip entrepreneurs with skills in marketing, digital marketing, branding, communication, leadership, accounting, cost analysis, and personal development.
4. Foster sustainable growth and international competitiveness by supporting the development of comprehensive five-year growth strategies.

Methodology:

Entrepreneur selection will be based on a rigorous assessment of their eligibility, using questionnaires, surveys, and field visits. Data collected will inform the development of a bespoke curriculum, which will include training in:

1. Good Manufacturing & Hygienic Practices
2. Marketing, Digital Marketing, and Branding; Communication and Leadership
3. Accounting and Cost Analysis
4. Personal Development and Soft Skills

Entrepreneurs will also draft a five-year growth proposal during their training, providing a practical application of their newly acquired knowledge.

Expected Outcomes:

1. Increased brand credibility and customer confidence through Label certification.
2. Enhanced competitiveness and market access, including potential for exportation.
3. Improved supply chain integrity and raw material supplier standards.
4. Streamlined due diligence processes and information provision.

By focusing on capacity-building and market access, this project aims to create a ripple effect that will elevate the standards of living for both the participating entrepreneurs and the wider Lebanese community. Through targeted investment in Lebanon's internal resources, we can foster sustainable growth and financial stability, contributing to the broader goal of international economic recovery.
